title: Offering Free coaching to 1 Bronze-Plat Player
body:
Here are my rules and regulations, if you cannot abide by these then don't bother.

1. Understand that league is absolute, Based on the geometry and numerals the game is built on, everything is set.
2. Accept your weaknesses and learn off of them.
3. Don't get offended or upset when I tell you like it is. I don't curse or become toxic with my sessions, I do however tell you when your wrong and have you understand it

Those are my rules, Pretty freakin simple.


Now, understand the way I coach and my strengths, I coach off of information of your playstyle, background and your strengths/weaknesses. I'm not here to 1v1 you or play with you, I'm here to give you the information you arent aware of. And before all you plat 5 players come at me like trolls, You're in the same boat. No one knows everything in this game and if your looking to improve and get better you have to understand this.

Now, If your interested post below, do not add me dear god I will not accept under any condition. I will contact you based on your response. In your response to my post explain to me why I should coach you and why you need coaching, 

My coaching session will last for a maximum of one month, or when I feel you are past my limits.

For those of you that have read over my post and found it interesting, thank you and I'm excited to contact anyone. For those of you who believe silvers can't coach, {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}  Have fun being stuck in your elo.

- Interesting. As a player that coaches in the KR server from players of all ranks. 
 ** Nothing is wrong with this post ** 
All of you guys complaining BS and asking him "Why, oh why, is a silver trying to coach me?" 

You may as well ask yourself why you would even bother posting. 
 ** You already have a poor attitude ** and coaching won't help you with that. 

Back to the point, and why I find this post **not** BS. 

There are three things that separates a professional gamer and the norm.
1) They have the attitude for it. They have a strong mindset and will ignore any negative comments. And, not just **act like they are ignoring**, they actually don't care nor have the time for it. These players are too focused on their own mistake and reflecting on it.
2) Game Knowledge (Intelligence). This is really important for players wishing to achieve higher than platinum. Although just strong mechanics can get one to platinum. But, after that, what separates Platinum from Diamonds/Masters/Challenger is Game Knowledge and Experience. 
--- Game Knowledge goes hand in hand with Decision Making.
3) Mechanics. This comes from Gameplay and A lot of Practice.

Kyukimon is offering #2 , and it is true, a silver player **CAN** be more knowledgeable than Bronze-Platinum; but not Diamond+. 

And don't take this as me saying Kyukimon is a good coach... because I've never had him coach me before. I am just saying, He may have the knowledge that you guys need and why not try him out? its free.

-- Your fellow Sexy and Grill Hot KR Coach - Felix.
@Felix213 - I'm pretty sure Silvers can be more knowledgeable than Diamond+, considering the existence of analysts like MonteCristo, although I understand that he's probably an outlier.

I'm not necessarily posting for coaching per-se, as I may very well be "beyond your limits" as you put it (although I'm more than willing to put that to the test if you would coach me anyway), but I would like to ask if you would add me as someone I could share information with and talk about the game to. 

If I had to answer the "why you should coach me" prompt, even though coaching me is probably a tall order for most, it's because I need an accountability partner as much as I need someone to help me keep my head in the game; in other words, I have consistency problems and I believe I would do well to find myself someone who can help me reach a better level of consistency and keep me disciplined and humble. 

Moreover, as someone who coaches others myself, I am always interested to see others coaching methods, as it helps me reform and improve my own. 

IGN: **Mylon Requiem**

I can tell what some of my weaknesses are, but I have no idea how I should improve on those that I did identify, let alone those that I didn't. If you feel that there are things you can help me out with, I look forward to hearing from you.
